Reviews.Title: LG Beacon
Reviews.Author: Brandy Allen "Brandy1279"
Reviews.Content: If you like to text a lot, than i would say that this could be the phone for you. The one thing i do like about this phone is that its a touch screen and it has the slide out QWERTY keyboard, compared to most of the androids out there that just have the touch screen keyboard. I personally like a keyboard where i can feel the keys and with the touch screen phones you don't have that. I would say that its more of a basic phone because it doesn't have a lot of different apps and games, though if you go with the 50 dollar plan I'm sure you can download them onto this phone, i went with the 45 dollar plan because i don't need internet on my phone since i have a laptop at home and i don't LIVE on the internet like some people do. It has the basic things that other phones usually have, its got a camera which is alright but sometimes it takes a picture too dark, but there is an adjustment on the phone and once you play with it a bit you get the hang of it. It has a music player, calendar, multimedia, alarm, tools which has your calculator, world clock, Ez tip calculator, it has a drawing panel if you want to doodle, which is an okay feature to have on your phone which i personally don't need. It has voice command, a notepad and you can have a blue tooth if you want that. Like i said its a basic phone, the call quality is alright, could be better but it all depends on the area you are in. The battery life is alright, if you text a lot and talk a lot through out the day then you will have to charge it up during the day so your phone doesn't die. Other than that, i personally like it, others might not but for the price i say its pretty good. I got a 30 rebate with the phone so i basically paid 30 dollars for it and when you get the rebate in the mail its a visa gift card so you can use it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: basic phone
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "Zarifa"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this phone for a little over a year now. It can be decent in some areas but fails in others.-This phone turned slow after months of use. I found it froze at points so I had to turn it off then back on.-The battery life lasts 3 days at MOST. If you text even a few times or listen to music, it'll probably last a day or less. This is sad because even with minor use, the battery dies fast. Even with no use, it can die within a few hours.-In order to put music on it, you need your own microSD card. The sound-quality is good though, not great but not bad at all. I would prefer if it had EQ settings. The manual for this feature was very vague.-The picture-quality is very good. It's very crisp. I like taking pictures on this thing. Sadly, it does not take videos though :(-I enjoy texting on the slide-out QWERTY keyboard. But remember that this phone is smaller than average phones so it may be a bit harder to text easily, but I still like texting on it.If you're someone who isn't expecting too much from a phone, this would be for you. But if you want a more fluid phone with video-taking capability and long battery-life, I suggest looking for a more expensive brand.
